Caption: Dr. A. L. Mudaliar addresses the audience
Description: Dr. A. L. Mudaliar completed his education from Madras Christian College. Following this, he served as Vice Chancellor of Madras University for a period of 27 years. He was also the principal of Madras Medical College. He was also the Deputy Leader of the Indian delegation to the First World Health Assembly in Geneva in 1948. Following this, Mudaliar was elected as the chairman of the World Health Organization (WHO) Executive Board in 1949 and 1950. Apart from this, Mudaliar was knighted in the 1945 New Year Honours. In 1954, he was awarded the Padma Bhushan and the Padma Vibhushan in 1963. Dr. A. L. Mudaliar talked about the accomplishments that IIT Madras was able to achieve including the status it earned as an 'Institution of National Importance' under an Act of Parliament passed in1961. He also thanked the Federal Republic of Germany, the Government of India and the Government of Madras for their co-operation. He mentioned "We deem this institution as one of the most important and fruitful of the Indo-German Projects in this country."
